Pastikan Harga Gas Tak Naik, Jokowi: Keluhan Industri Saya Tangkap
01 Nov 2019, 09:28 by Marlinda Oktavia Erwanti


Foto: Andhika Prasetia/detikcom

Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) memastikan tak ada kenaikan harga gas industri. Hal itu mengonfirmasi bahwa PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk atau PGN batal menaikkan harga gas per 1 November 2019 ini."Sementara ini saya sampaikan tidak naik," kata Jokowi di Kompleks Istana Kepresidenan, Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Jokowi mengaku memahami adanya keluhan industri mengenai harga gas. Harga gas ini menyangkut produk yang dihasilkan oleh industri."Sejak dulu kan saya katakan bahwa yang namanya efisiensi harga-harga minyak maupun gas sangat penting karena akan menyangkut produk-produk yang dihasilkan oleh industri kita. Dan keluhan (industri) itu saya tangkap," ujarnya.Bahkan menurut Jokowi untuk industri-industri tertentu, harga gas sangat menentukan sekali. Maka dirinya meminta Menteri Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) Arifin Tasrif untuk melihat kembali penyebab harga gas mahal."Oleh sebab itu saya sudah menyampaikan kepada Menteri ESDM kemarin agar betul-betul yang namanya harga gas itu dilihat lagi" sebutnya.Kemarin, Menteri ESDM Arifin Tasrif sudah menerangkan bahwa harga gas tidak akan naik, minimal sampai akhir tahun."Sampai akhir tahun pasti (harga gas industri tidak naik)," kata dia di Istana Kepresidenan, Jakarta, Kamis (31/10/2019).Dia mengungkapkan alasan pemerintah memutuskan kebijakan tersebut. Hal itu demi menjaga daya saing industri dalam negeri."Karena kita ingin industri kita kompetitif. (Harga gas industri) tidak naik. Supaya dalam situasi kondisi ekonomi saat ini berat, jadi kalau naik juga bisa menyebabkan dampak yang tidak baik untuk industri. Industri juga menyerap banyak tenaga kerja," ungkapnya.Simak Video "Jokowi Ingin Industrialisasi Pertahanan Berorientasi Ekspor"[Gambas:Video 20detik](toy/eds)

Ensure Gas Prices Are Not Going Up, Jokowi: I Arrested Industrial Complaints
Nov 1, 2019, 09:28 by Marlinda Oktavia Erwanti


Photo: Andhika Prasetia / detikcom

Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) ensured that there was no increase in industrial gas prices. This confirms that PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk or PGN canceled raising the price of gas as of November 1, 2019. "For the time being, I conveyed that it did not rise," Jokowi said at the Presidential Palace Complex, Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019). understand the existence of industry complaints regarding gas prices. The price of gas is related to products produced by the industry. "I have always said that the name of the efficiency of oil and gas prices is very important because it will concern the products produced by our industry. And the complaints (industry) I have caught," he said. Even according to Jokowi for certain industries, the price of gas is very crucial. So he asked the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) Arifin Tasrif to look back at the causes of expensive gas prices. "Therefore, I have conveyed to the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources yesterday so that the name of the gas price will be seen again" he said. Yesterday, the Minister ESDM Arifin Tasrif has explained that gas prices will not rise, at least until the end of the year. "Until the end of the year (industrial gas prices will not go up)," he said at the Presidential Palace, Jakarta, Thursday (10/31/2019). the government's reason for deciding the policy. This is for the sake of maintaining the competitiveness of domestic industries. "Because we want our industry to be competitive. (Industrial gas prices) do not rise. So that in the current economic conditions is severe, so if it rises can also cause adverse effects to the industry. The industry also absorbs a lot of labor, "he said.
